detailsOfAchievement: The NGO has been active from a long span of last 10 years within rural and urban areas of India and has successfully implemented a number of 15 community development programs in more than a number of 250 villages i.e. FORMATION OF 900 SHGs, water management and sanitation, adult literacy, poverty elimination, livelihood support, rural tourism development, Rural Habitat, RCH, old age home, HIV/AIDS, gender equality, right to information, rehabilitation of tribes etc. It has formed a number of approx 900 SHGs ensured linkage with alternative livelihood resources i.e. poultry, thresher, Teracota, tent house, dairy, goatery, bamboo artifacts, oil & flour mills, tailoring, cycle shop, seed replacement, grain trading, seed formation, agricultural implements, brick kilns, shuttering works, diesel pump, low cost building material, synthetic carpet, general merchant shops in rural area etc. Some innovative activities like community health center; Renovation of water resources for irrigation; construction of platform for SHG meetings; land entitlement for tribes in tiger reserve area, developing water management system in draught area etc.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Prem Sagar Special School run by Daughters of St. Thomas Society. It is functioning in the field of mentally challenged children. It has not kept any barrier of age and category of disability. It is collaborating with all Government schemes. At present 75 beneficiaries are getting benefits from the school. Besides the academic activities we are giving vocational training also. The main aim of the school is to bring the mentally challenged children in the main stream of the society. Thanks a lot.

Prem Sagar Special School was established by the Daughters of St. Thomas Society with the objective of development and rehabilitation of the mentally challenged children.Prem Sagar Special School Started in a rented building with four students. After four years we purchased four acres of land and shifted our school to new building in Ninety Ninety Six. The school got registration from the social justice department Bhopal in the same year. By the grace of theGod we got grant in aid from the MSJE.

Prem Sagar Special School was established by the Daughters of St. Thomas Society with the objective of development and rehabilitation of the mentally challenged children. Major Activities and achievemnets : Mild, moderate and severe categories of children with cerebral palsy, autism and multiple disabilities Special training in various classes Assessment and program planning Physiotheraphy Vocational Training Participation in sports and cultural activities . We are conducting theCBR programmes.

The Society of Daughters St. Thomas is established for the upliftment and the benefit of the poor communities specially of women and the weaker section of the society without the distinction of cast and creed. To perform works of charity by providing medical services, educational facilities, health care activities and other social works for the betterment of the downtrodden. To held and conduct classes, conferences, seminars, competitions and give scholarships and awards whom found necessary.

The second set will talk about the understanding and use of power by local bodies at district and sub-district level. The prop

Government of India Decided to Identify the poor through SECC 2011. The government laid down several process to ensure transparency so that actual poor are identified in both rural and urban areas. Debate started the project to generate awareness amongst the community and the elected representatives of the local government so that they actively participate in the census and assist the government machinery in ensuring a good and transparent census. the campaign was organised in 32 districts.

Government of Madhya Pradesh, in collaboration with UN Women started a project of supporting elected Women Panchayat Representatives to make them effective leader at grass roots level. Debate was assigned the responsibility of Documenting the learnings of the project implemented in three districts Namely Sagar, Sehore and Jhabua.

Debate prepared the district plan for ICDP project of Government of India and Madhya Pradesh for district Gwalior. The project aimed at assessing the current status of the institutions of cooperative in district and based on this assessment a comprehensive plan for the development of cooperatives, in Gwalior, had to be prepared. debate prepared the district plan which was approved by State and Centre and the project is currently being implemented by the Cooperative Department.

Panchayats and Municipalities are expected to prepare annual plan for economic development and social justice for their respective areas. As per the concerned state laws the local governments are preparing plan since 1994. These plans have not been part of state and national plan due to the lack of appropriate policy, institutional gap for linking the plan and lack of appropriate capacity to link the plans of local governments with plan of state and nation.

State Planning Commission. of MP, gave responsibility to preparing a thematic report on Status of preparing and implementing the concept of gender budget by the government departments. Debate reviewed the current practice of preparing gender budget, using the concept during planning and process of ensuring that actual benefit reaches to women. The study was based on the review of secondary documents and collection of data from five districts Namely Rajgarh, Satna, Mandla, Balaghat and khargone

detailsOfAchievement: The main aim of our All India Level Educational Society is to remove illiteracy from members of the minority and other socially and unprivileged sections of society, as also to equip them with skills to enable these members to lead a life of dignity and self respect. Accordingly the society setup an English Medium school named as Gharibnawaz School of Excellence in Ginnori locality of Bhopal in the year 2003 which is affiliated with MP Board of Secondary Education Bhopal from KG to Class X. The school is imparting quality education to the students at very nominal tuition fee and the results have so far been very encouraging. We have purchased 2.5 acres of land in village Arwaliya which is about 8 kms from Bhopal town where we propose to construct a proper school building with hostel facility as the present building is small is not able to accommodate more students. We have also opened a Vocational Training Centre named as Umang in our school premises which provides training free of cost to women coming from poor families in trades like cutting and tailoring, computer applications and artificial jewellery. So far we have over 1000 poor ladies most of whom have started their own business specially in cutting and tailoring trades enabling them to earn sufficient money to meet their household expenses. We have resolved this charitable work in our institution. In addition our school takes active part extra curricular activities including sports and academics. We are happy to state that our school took part in a state level academic competition called Bal Rung in which the students wrote an excellent article on Goa which has been submitted to Manav Sangralaya, Indira Gandhi Bhawan, Shyamla Hills, Bhopal. In addition our students regularly take part in social and educational activities organised by Urdu Academy Govt of MP Bhopal as for example one held recently on famous poet Iqbal. Our school organises outdoor trip to historical places every year. We also have social gatherings and fates every year in our school. Our students also take part in debates and recently took part in reciting Naths (sufi poetry) organised by the local municipal councellor in which prices were one by them. We plan to open a Play school and Nursery classes in our school premises from next academic year we have also drawn up a calender of events highlighting the extra curricular activities which would be undertaken in the year 2017 - 2018.
